summary: Email chain from August 12, 2019, between New York law enforcement/Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) personnel regarding the coordination of evidence transfer and interviews related to the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss sending evidence (including the decedent's clothing) to OCME and coordinating interviews with those who discovered the body.

persons.name: Dr Detective
persons.context: Mentioned as being on his way to deliver evidence (likely clothing) to the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) in relation to Epstein's death.

connections.description: Dr Detective is transporting evidence (clothing) to MD, the medical examiner, for examination as part of the death investigation.

events.title: Evidence transfer and interview coordination
events.description: Law enforcement coordinates the transfer of evidence (Epstein's clothing) to the medical examiner's office and plans interviews with individuals who discovered Epstein's body.

events.title: Initial contact from medical examiner
events.description: Medical examiner MD establishes email contact for coordination regarding the Epstein death investigation.

locations: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME)
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 12, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
It shows active coordination between law enforcement and the medical examiner's office to transfer evidence, specifically the clothing Epstein was wearing when found.
Interviews were being planned with individuals who discovered Epstein's body, indicating an ongoing death investigation.
The correspondence highlights procedural steps taken immediately following Epstein's death to secure and examine evidence.
